channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Two key inflation reports this week will help decide the size of the Fed's interest rate cut
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics will first release the consumer price index Wednesday and then the producer price index Thursday, both measuring August prices.

item.title: Volkswagen scraps a slew of labor agreements as standoff with unions intensifies
item.description: German automotive giant Volkswagen on Tuesday said it was scrapping a slew of labor agreements.

item.title: Apple must pay 13 billion euros in back taxes, EU's top court rules
item.description: Europe's top court on Tuesday ruled against Apple in the tech giant's 10-year court battle over its tax affairs in Ireland.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase shares drop 5% after bank tempers guidance on interest income and expenses
item.description: JPMorgan Chase shares plummeted after the bank said estimates for net interest income next year were too high.

item.title: Huawei launches $2,800 trifold phone hours after Apple debuts iPhone 16
item.description: The Mate XT comes in red and black, in three storage options with prices ranging from 19,999 yuan ($2,809) to 23,999 yuan ($3,371).

item.title: Car giants are being forced to confront some hard truths over the EV transition
item.description: European car giants are struggling to come to terms with a perfect storm of challenges on the path to full electrification.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says 'the worst outcome is stagflation,' a scenario he's not taking off the table
item.description: The CEO of the biggest U.S. bank says he sees a raft of inflationary forces on the horizon, including higher deficits and increased infrastructure spending.

item.title: SpaceX launches Polaris Dawn mission, which will attempt the first private spacewalk
item.description: It is the first of three missions that billionaire Jared Isaacman purchased from SpaceX in 2022 for his human spaceflight effort known as the Polaris Program.

item.title: This 29-year-old millionaire doesn’t own a home — here’s how he spends and invests his money instead
item.description: Timothy Armoo is not what you might expect from a multi-millionaire.

item.title: Melania Trump questions Trump assassination attempt story: 'We need to uncover the truth'
item.description: The tweet by Melania Trump promoting her new book came hours before Donald Trump was due to debate Vice President Kamala Harris in Philadelphia.

item.title: Sony unveils upgraded PlayStation 5 Pro to boost slowing console business
item.description: Sony on Tuesday unveiled an upgraded version of its PlayStation 5 console, called the PlayStation 5 Pro.

item.title: Oracle is designing a data center that would be powered by three small nuclear reactors
item.description: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison did not disclose the location of the data center or the future reactors.

item.title: AstraZeneca shares fall 5% on disappointing lung cancer drug trial results
item.description: AstraZeneca shares fell more than 5% Tuesday morning, the biggest one-day drop in seven months, after the British pharmaceutical giant announced disappointing lung cancer drug trial results.

item.title: Federal Reserve unveils toned-down banking regulations in victory for Wall Street
item.description: Bank CEOs led by JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon have lambasted the proposed Basel Endgame regulation since it was unveiled last year.

item.title: Former Arm CEO criticizes Britain for not holding onto its top tech firms
item.description: Warren East, who led Arm between 1994 and 2013, said that too often tech firms in Britain move their operations overseas or list elsewhere abroad.

item.title: New Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol outlines priorities to end coffee chain's slump
item.description: Starbucks named Brian Niccol its CEO in August, trusting him to turn around the coffee chain's slumping sales.

item.title: Huawei's trifold phone gets 2.7 million pre-orders ahead of Apple's iPhone 16 launch
item.description: Huawei has received more than 2.7 million pre-orders for its new, trifold smartphone, according to its website Monday.

item.title: Presidential debate crib sheet: U.S. economy numbers to know
item.description: Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris are each trying to pitch themselves as the best candidate for the U.S. economy.

item.title: Southwest Chair Kelly to step down next year as activist Elliott pushes for changes at airline
item.description: Elliott has pushed for a leadership overhaul at Southwest, which earlier this year made some of the biggest operational changes in its history.

item.title: Google's 2.4 billion euro fine upheld by Europe's top court in EU antitrust probe
item.description: The fine stems from an antitrust investigation by European Union regulators into Google that concluded in 2017.

item.title: 'Spook the West': Turkey's bid for BRICS both a strategic and symbolic step, analysts say
item.description: BRICS is seen by some as a symbolic counterweight to Western-led organizations like the EU, the G7 and even NATO.

item.title: In Huawei’s battle against Apple, chips are still a weakness, says analyst
item.description: As Huawei battles it out with Apple in China, its chip capabilities remain a weakness, despite recent breakthroughs, according to one analyst.

item.title: China's exports grow by 8.7% in August, beating expectations
item.description: China's exports have been a bright spot in an economy otherwise struggling to boost domestic demand.

item.title: Investors are 'dramatically overestimating' an oil glut, Carlyle's Jeff Currie says
item.description: Global markets are severely overplaying an oil supply glut, said Jeff Currie, chief strategy officer of energy pathways at private equity giant Carlyle.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets mixed as investors digest China trade data
item.description: China's exports grew 8.7% year-on-year in August and imports grew 0.5%, compared to the forecast of 6.5% and 2% in a Reuters poll.

item.title: Cautious Chinese travelers are taking more last-minute trips as economy struggles
item.description: Chinese travelers are taking more last-minute trips as they become more cautious with spending amid lackluster economic recovery.

item.title: K-pop is more popular than ever, but that isn't helping agency stock prices
item.description: K-pop is seeing increasing popularity, with records being shattered on streaming services and concert crowds, but this is not reflected in the sector's share prices

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Did Apple’s shiny new things uplift markets?
item.description: Maybe all it takes are shiny new things to lift our mood and take our minds off recession fears.

item.title: Bitcoin rebounds from its worst week in more than a year, jumping above $57,000
item.description: Bitcoin jumped 6% Monday evening, following Wall Street's rebound from its worst week of the year.

item.title: Jumbo 50 basis points Fed rate cut should not raise alarm, analyst says
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve can afford to make a jumbo 50 basis points rate cut next week without spooking markets, an analyst suggested Monday.
